intro: Euploca serpylloides, commonly known as the slender euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Euploca serpylloides is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
